I'm torn. On the one hand, I should probably get some rest for tomorrow's final. On the other hand, I know my shit's gonna blow everyone else's out of the water and I literally have nothing to worry about, so screw it, more Monster Hunter Beta.

Well I also have to do an oral presentation for the showing, but I got that on lockdown for moderately obvious reasons.
Public speaking has been good to me after I hit middle school.
Heh. I can imagine.
Though I did forget my lines in a school play in the second grade and just stood there crying, so I wasn't always amazeballs.
From that day forward, I promised myself, "NEVER AGAIN WILL I BE DEFEATED
Current defeat record since then?
Only been knocked out twice.
Once by my eye doctor.
That was funny as hell.

I was super not okay after a really long shift, hadn't eaten all day, barely anything to drink, and when the doc starting probing my eyeball I had a bit of a panic attack and my body was like, "Fuck it, I'm out..."
Woke up with him supporting my upper body as I slumped out of the chair.
Doc said I was the third that year. Rare, but it happens.
That sounds really convenient considering

The other time was when I asked this super androgynous kid in the eighth grade if they were a dude or a chick in my English class. They slammed the back of my jaw, right on the button with a textbook. GG, lights out for me.
Never figured it out either.
Got into a few fights other than that, came out on top otherwise.
You didn't deserve that one, Dadro
they're just a shitty kid
don't worry about it
Hahaha
I would have jumped his ass for ya
that's bull xD
happens a lot here
I feel like I'd REALLY wanna know if a girl knocked me out
I'm moderately sure it was just a really lithe dude who hadn't quite gotten the hang of puberty yet.
Had no way to see it coming, another kid started talking to me right before I got blindsided.
But not COMPLETELY
But it's whatever.
It's a funny story now.
Could've been a natani in training
Maybe that's why I like TK so much; I'm still subconsciously trying to figure all this gender stuff out.
This IS the webcomic to do it
No, this is the comic to obfuscate the matter further.
Eh either or
No, that's the point I think, that there is no either/or. There's a lot of grey area.
At least, I think that's the point.
Touche. I like to think the point is that in the end it's not all that important
There ya go!
"Fuck it, I got mine" That's a motto to live by!

Next semester I'm gonna spend the first two or so weeks working on the project some more. We're gonna head into the studio proper and mix it in 5.1 Surround to get our feet wet in that area.
